title: Philemon 1:1
content: 1 Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and our brother Timothy to Philemon, the beloved and our fellow worker,

title: Philemon 1:2
content: 2 and to Apphia our sister, and to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house.

title: Philemon 1:3
content: 3 Grace to you and peace from God our Father and our Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Philemon 1:4
content: 4 I always thank my God, making mention of you in my prayers,

title: Philemon 1:5
content: 5 hearing of your love and the faith that you have in the Lord Jesus and for all the saints,

title: Philemon 1:6
content: 6 that the fellowship of your faith may become effective through the knowledge of everything good {that is} among us for Christ.

title: Philemon 1:7
content: 7 For I had much joy and comfort because of your love, because the inner parts of the saints are being refreshed by you, brother.

title: Philemon 1:8
content: 8 Therefore, having much boldness in Christ to command you the {thing that} is proper {to do},

title: Philemon 1:9
content: 9 because of love I appeal to you instead—being such a one as Paul, an elder, and now also a prisoner of Christ Jesus.

title: Philemon 1:10
content: 10 I am appealing to you on behalf of my child Onesimus, whom I have fathered in my chains.

title: Philemon 1:11
content: 11 The one formerly useless to you, but now useful both to you and to me,

title: Philemon 1:12
content: 12 whom I have sent back to you—him—this one is my inner parts;

title: Philemon 1:13
content: 13 whom I desired to keep with me, so that he might serve me on behalf of you in the chains of the gospel.

title: Philemon 1:14
content: 14 But I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that your good {deed} might not be as according to compulsion but according to good will.

title: Philemon 1:15
content: 15 For perhaps because of this he was separated from {you} for an hour, so that you might have him back forever,

title: Philemon 1:16
content: 16 no longer as a slave, but better than a slave—a beloved brother, especially to me, but much more so to you, in both the flesh and in the Lord.

title: Philemon 1:17
content: 17 Therefore, if you have me {as} a partner, receive him as me.

title: Philemon 1:18
content: 18 But if he has wronged you or owes {you} anything, charge that to me.

title: Philemon 1:19
content: 19 I, Paul, wrote this with my own hand. I myself will pay it back—in order not to say to you that you also owe me even your own self!

title: Philemon 1:20
content: 20 Yes, brother, may I benefit from you in the Lord; refresh my inner parts in Christ.

title: Philemon 1:21
content: 21 Having become confident in your obedience, I wrote to you, having known that you will do even beyond what I am saying.

title: Philemon 1:22
content: 22 But at the same time, also prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be given back to you.

title: Philemon 1:23
content: 23 Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,

title: Philemon 1:24
content: 24 Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, {and} Luke, my fellow workers.

title: Philemon 1:25
content: 25 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ {be} with your spirit. Amen.
